Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 8GB Unlocked- Black
name: abrykwall
Reviews: This was a ridiculous purchase. The condition was listed as " New "....I guess I should have known better. Right out of the box I could tell it wasn't " New " because it came packaged with a Non-Apple Charging Unit. The first thing I noticed was the battery life was terrible, it died overnight. Secondly, I was on a 30 minute phonecall and started noticing the unit heating up very bad. Next thing I noticed was the digits started pressing themselves, I thought it was my cheek at first but when I pulled it away from my face the numbers were still being pressed. Well, it had heated up so much that I had to hang up and put the until down. Too many issues to bother with.I told my symptoms to a co-worker who repairs iPhones as his second job.The heating up was due to cheap Chinese replacement parts. There was no heat plate behind the glass to absorb the heat from the backlight which in turn caused it to act funny.Would not buy online again unless I knew it was new.I learned from this. This experience prompted me to go out and buy a brand new iPhone 5c from a non contract phone company. I'm very happy with it. It was well worth the $200.00 dollars more that I paid for a new iPhone 5c. If there is only a $200.00 dollar difference between a brand new phone an a seller on Amazon, do yourself a favor, pay the money and buy new.

This product alone however is beautiful, runs like a new phone, and slick to the touch. I'd recommend this seller in using phones but beware---cutting a go phone sim card can be costly when doing it wrong. I advise just getting the new at&t sim card and getting a new number. It'll save much disappointment and money.BIG THING HERE: The seller sent the product on time and earlier than I expected. It arrived in a package and bubble wrap ( love bubble wrap). There were no scratches, or hints of it ever being used---I've read some reviews and said this wasn't so, but on mine it's brand new. Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 8GB Unlocked- Black
name: johntrack
Reviews: Wonderful phone as long as nothing goes wrong in the first year because although it should have a warranty since it is being sold as a new phone ours was not new. I recommend if you buy this phone that you call in the serial number to Apple as soon as you get it. That is how we found out that our "new" phone was used. I would love to tell you more but Amazon keeps deleting my posts and says this information is not pertinent to the product.... What do you think?Edited review-,After appealing to Amazon customer service they did agree to post my original review. The main problem is that many consumers may not be aware of the fact that there are quite a few 3rd party distributors selling phones on Amazon that they are claiming to be new. If they are indeed new and unused you should have a one year Apple warranty from the date of your purchase. I recommend calling Apple with the serial number as soon as you receive the phone to verify this. Don't wait until something goes wrong because you will have to go through what I went through. I am still waiting for my daughter's replacement phone. Crossing my fingers that it is truly new

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 8GB Unlocked- Black
name: elias02
Reviews: This phone was sold as a brand new factory unlocked phone. All new iPhones have a one year warranty. This phone would not hold a charge less than a month after I gave it to my daughter. She thought it was the charger and bought a new one. It still would never charge to 100%. After a couple of hours it would be at 50% even when it was off and not in use. A couple of weeks ago it started going from 50% to 9% as soon as my daughter turned it on. Since it was supposed to be new I told my daughter to check with Apple to do trouble shooting. She did this online by entering her serial number. The on line trouble shooting identified a problem with the battery which would normally be covered by warranty. However, she was told that the phone has no warranty because it was originally purchased by someone over 600 days ago! I paid $208 for a phone that was supposed to be new but instead has a bum battery and no warranty. This should not be legal. Who knows whether the phone was stolen or purchased and returned by someone else. Regardless, it is not NEW as it was advertised and Amazon needs to provide a full refund regardless of whether it is past the regular return date. This was actually a Prime purchase and Amazon is responsible for making sure the products they ship are as advertised.

Reviews: This device is advertised as GSM UNLOCKED, it's actually a CDMA VERIZON phone !, which means it cannot be used when you travel because it has NO SIM CARD SLOT ,most carriers worldwide use GSM technology,why on earth does the ad say it's GSM when it's not so ? on top of that it was $ 160 when I bought it and it's now $ 102 ,I wonder why...bottom line , I really got the short end of the stick, I've heard other complaints from some of my friends getting the wrong items (not as advertised), I'd thought of buying yet another phone from amazon but after hearing so many complaints I think I just might be better off buying it in a store,just to make sure it's really unlocked and it works with any carrier in any country, that's what GSM means,freedom to choose any carrier anywhere with any sim card but this phone doesn't even have a sim card slot, I did get a 50 % refund but after realizing it's only a cdma phone I feel really let down

name: ElmiraBudMan
Reviews: Phone4My I-phone4 arrived as promised. The package said: Can not be returned when opened. Based on my experience with many Apple products during the last 20+ years, I opened it.After installing the SIM card it showed a high signal atthe T-Mobil store.At home the signal was 4dots at turn on. After dialing a number, the signal dropped to one dot,after a few seconds to surging, and finally to no signal. This process is very repeatable. The Apple store recommended a new SIM card. Same result:worked in the store, not outside. Back to the Apple store. They reinstalledand up grated the whole program. NO CHANGE!!!According to the local Apple store, the phone was first sold in 2011. Not exactly a new phone.I now know where not to buy cell phones.How do I know what's in the box. The Apple store will turn it on for me andreplace it right there, if it doesn't work.I just kissed $245.50 good by.All your other products were great and I will continue to be your customer.Peter Simeth

name: LaceyDGarland
Reviews: Phone4My I-phone4 arrived as promised. The package said: Can not be returned when opened. Based on my experience with many Apple products during the last 20+ years, I opened it.After installing the SIM card it showed a high signal atthe T-Mobil store.At home the signal was 4dots at turn on. After dialing a number, the signal dropped to one dot,after a few seconds to surging, and finally to no signal. This process is very repeatable. The Apple store recommended a new SIM card. Same result:worked in the store, not outside. Back to the Apple store. They reinstalledand up grated the whole program. NO CHANGE!!!According to the local Apple store, the phone was first sold in 2011. Not exactly a new phone.I now know where not to buy cell phones.How do I know what's in the box. The Apple store will turn it on for me andreplace it right there, if it doesn't work.I just kissed $245.50 good by.All your other products were great and I will continue to be your customer.Peter Simeth

Then when it arrived, I found that it was brand new, never been activated, or even had the plastic film taken off the screen............and I paid less than $70 for it. I went back & re-read the description of how Amazon classes "new, used, good" and although this one was listed as "used", the only thing missing was the original box but for a savings I got, the box was irrelevant. I gave him his Christmas present early to make sure everything was ok with it, and it was, so he is one happy kid.

name: maddie_helms
Reviews: The phone is great. The problem is the product description. I bought this phone thinking it was for straight talk (product description). I went to the store. Purchased the card and then tried to activate the phone. I was on the phone for an hour with straight talk. They kept telling me they couldn't identify the phone. They couldn't activate it, nothing. As I'm on the phone with them I am looking at the about section for the phone and that's when I see Carrier: Verizon. My phone was not for straight talk. It was for Verizon. After reading more and more reviews from others about this phone I saw that some people were having the same problem as me. I went onto Verizon and had the phone activated in ten minutes. Phone is great. Came with charger and ear buds. Just be sure to check the carrier listed on the phone.

GO Wireless replaced the phone for free, but the "new" phone has a touch screen that doesn't work properly on the right side. Please, save yourself the trouble and don't buy this product from GO Wireless.

name: Dr24hours
Reviews: The phone is great. The problem is the product description. I bought this phone thinking it was for straight talk (product description). I went to the store. Purchased the card and then tried to activate the phone. I was on the phone for an hour with straight talk. They kept telling me they couldn't identify the phone. They couldn't activate it, nothing. As I'm on the phone with them I am looking at the about section for the phone and that's when I see Carrier: Verizon. My phone was not for straight talk. It was for Verizon. After reading more and more reviews from others about this phone I saw that some people were having the same problem as me. I went onto Verizon and had the phone activated in ten minutes. Phone is great. Came with charger and ear buds. Just be sure to check the carrier listed on the phone.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 A1332 32GB Black (GSM Unlocked)
name: OP_Rahul
Reviews: When I received this iphone 4 it was in great condition, but it somehow slipped through the cracks and the unlock and updated os was not completed. I found this out when I tried to have a prepaid service turned on and shelled out $60 for a chip that was nonrefundable. I was furious, I expected the worst to try and resolve this issue, but when I emailed him on Friday night about 6 pm western time he responded within 20 minutes. He apologized profusely and talked me through how to finish the unlock and update til 11:30. then when I installed my new chip it works fine and has been fine ever since I would definitely recommend and buy from this seller again. Things happen and he stood behind his product well past regular business hours.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 A1332 32GB Black (GSM Unlocked)
name: jessouc
Reviews: It wasn’t only a refurbished item instead of unused item. The IPhone 4 I received and sent back is a fraud.On october 17, I spent more than 2 hours at the Genius Bar of Apple Store at 5th Avenue, New York. They recommended me to do a back up first and come back the other day.The following day, 18, in Apple Store at 14th Street, New York, I spent another 2 hours at the Genius Bar just to know 1) that they couldn't just replace the phone because it was out of warranty - it expired two years before, one year after it had been bought by its first owner, in June 2010. So if wanted a replacement I'd have to pay US$ 150 for it - which I accepted; and 2) at the very moment of the transaction, the guy who served me at the shop counter noticed something in the iPhone and asked me to wait. He checked the serial number and found that the iPhone was originally a black one - the one I bought was a white one. He couldn't replace it.They didn't have a new iPhone 4 to sell, and I needed desperately to buy a cell phone because I was leaving the next day to Brazil. I bought an iPhone 5C unlocked for $649 + taxes, as you can see in the annexed file. Total: US$ 706.59.If you want to be fair, please deposit the difference of U$ 266,50 (706,59 - 439,98) I had to pay. I wont charge for the four hours of my vacation I wasted at Apple’s counter, neither for the worry and inconvenience I had with your item .I send alrady several emails and I'm still waiting for an answer. Hope to hear from you soon.

Reviews: I love my iPhone even though I have not been able to use it. I've always loved iPhone and was waiting patiently to get one. I called APPLE and they said a cut SIM will NOT work, I'll HAVE TO get a micro sim, as the connections are different. FOR THIS, APPLE LOSES 1 STAR because now I have to wait another day and spend some money with another network to get a micro sim in order to use my phone - Boo!Until then, it's back to my faithful iTouch.. BTW, my cut sim is back in my Nokia and working fine, so it wasn't damaged during the cut. Learn from my misinformation and don't waste ur $ on a Micro SIM Cutter, Converter with 2 SIM adapters UNTIL you verify a cut SIM will work with the SIM provider and others on the network.One-day shipping was great. Got all my items securely packaged and intact. Thanks Amazon.

name: DGHomeChef
Reviews: As stated in the description, the iPhone had little to no scratches around the phone. Good Job here. After turning it on, here's where the problems began to stir up. Due note that I previously owned a 4s prior and only ordered this one because I loved the phone, lost the phone and thought I'd try another one.Music - I'm a BIG fan of music. With this phone, I am not able to play music, smoothly from Tune In as once before. The issue starts whenever I have Wifi and Carrier service on at the same time. Never a problem with prior.GMaps + Music - Normally, I could listen to music while getting directions from GMaps. With this phone, every turn-by-turn direction causes my music to stop completely and I have to press play in order to start the music again. Never a problem with prior.Home Double-Tap Button - When I attempt to use this feature to navigate through opened apps, it would work about 1 out of 5 tries. Never a problem with prior.Wifi On/Off - Normally, I could turn my wifi on/off, interchangeably, between use with apps and never had a problem; however, apps recognize that the wifi is off and only consider this the designated source for data transfer. To fix, I've had to turn the phone off completely for it to refresh. Never a problem with prior.I am currently in the process of returning this phone, for they have a 90 Day Return policy. Fingers are crossed to see if I get a better replacement.Hopefully this review has helped make a decision for you in the future.

name: ElizabethFrayer
Reviews: When I got the package everything looked all right, but appearances can be deceiving. The USB connector would not accept any cable, just the one shipped inside. This is weird, but I could live with that glitch. Then, 2 weeks later, I noticed that all pictures taken with the front camera got blured and the 5M Pixels back camera had some issues in focusing the image.After 2 months using, I figured some extra bad surprises. The front speaker just went dead 3 days ago, the phone wont ring or produce any sound anymore!!!! Also, there is something wrong with the earphone jack as well, because during song playing we can hear "pops" and sudden pauses, just like in vynil players. Moreover, the "Face Proximity Sensor" never worked, but I didnt even know it exists, so I could not find out sooner.I took it to an Apple authorized Repair Shop, and to my surprise I was informed that identified that the iPhone was refurbished with a lot of low quality spare parts, including the cameras (back and front ones), and even the front touch screen glass!!I have no doubt that the phone was not "Very good" as advertised. Not at all!! I payed a good money for it, and will cost me a lot of extra money to repair it, which is not acceptable.

Reviews: Check out this facebook page that outlines their shady business practices: [...]The 1-star rating is not for the iphone itself - that would be a 5-star. The 1-star rating is for the seller - WIREOVIAI bought this in March 2012, seeing that it was "Factory Unlocked by Apple, Never Opened" and "New In Shrink-Wrap and Original Packaging".Just yesterday, a little over 2 months of having the phone, the speaker stopped working so I bring it into Apple, thinking it would be covered under warranty.The apple employee informs me that the iphone was owned and registered in September 2010 - 17 months before I bought this "new" iphone.Do not buy ANYTHING from this vendor - WIREOVIA - as you cannot trust the authenticity of what they're selling! What you buy would also not be covered under the manufacturer's warranty if it's older than you think it is. You will just end up with a useless, piece of junk and less several hundred dollars.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 A1332 32GB Black (GSM Unlocked)
name: Le_Sport1
Reviews: Bought2 of these through Vantage Cellular. The phones were wrapped like new. Looked great. All appeared good. Then little things were noticed. When the screen went black I would see phantom keyboard characters throughout the screen. Similar to how monitors react if the same picture stays on too long and the pixels freeze, same thins with this. I was supposed to get iPhone 4S', not 4's. I even verified the link after purchase and it showed up 4S. Now I had a problem with one phone not turning on and just a black screen. Was told it was the battery, when the phone was opened to replace said battery, low and behold - These aren't real iPhones. So now my ordered iPhone 4S' turn out to be fake iPhone 4's. Will will say 'return them and why did you not send them back right away?' Well, I work overseas and was only home to pick them up for a very short time and returning them was out of the question as the phones were needed when I returned. So how do we fix this? Stay tuned and I will update this as things unfold.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 A1332 32GB Black (GSM Unlocked)
name: LindsaySweeting
Reviews: After saving up for several months, I was able to purchase my very first high-end phone. At the time I first bought this phone, it was still considered out of date, but I didn't care. I was very excited to finally have an all in one high quality music player, cell phone, and handheld computer. I remember being most excited, besides the app inclusions, that this product had 32 whole gb to play with. That was more than I'd ever had in my mp3 players/ ipods of the past.Pros-Huge GB Space-App Store-High quality music playback (However, I believe the Sansa line of Mp3 players has a much better quality of music playback and higher volume offering. This is the only one I have found.)-Glass pieces rather than plastic-Unlocked for use with multiple phone servicesCons-Buggy at times-Outdated-Does not support many apps-New OS does not run very smoothly on this-One speaker was busted-Grossly overpriced-You can find an Andriod that improves on this system in every way for a quarter of the priceI have since updated to a less expensive Android phone with expandable memory (LG K700) as even the cheap ones run better OS than this old thing nowadays. For the time though, this piece of software was very innovative and very exciting to have. If you are in the market for a new phone, I would recommend a newer piece of equipment though, rather than springing for this item, even if it is the Apple Store you are looking for. Many apps do not even run on this any longer. A new andriod would save your pocket some dough, and offer you higher improvements.

name: beekaytulsa
Reviews: Never buy from Next Gen Wireless.The phone I got had a broken receiver and I could only listen to phone calls on speaker phone. I had to return the phone after spending hours looking online for solutions and trying to figure out what the problem was. When I contacted them about the problem and returned it, they said they would 'have their technicians inspect it' before refunding the money. The phone most definitely did not work and they got back to me saying that their technicians couldnt find anything wrong with the phone and that they would refund me, but charge me a "restocking fee" since the phone was now "used."On top of that, they sent me fake headphones and a fake charging cord. Apple blocks unauthorized lightning cords and when I finally gave up with the phone and went to back it up before returning it, the cord never worked, never charged the phone, and couldnt form a connection with my itunes. The battery life on the phone was also practically nothing which leads me to believe the phone was either also fake or used/refurbished. Either one sucks since I paid for what was listed as a new phone and ended up paying them to take it back "used" - probably to sell it to someone else new again.If I could I would give 0 stars. This is a bs product from a bs company with terrible customer service and service, period.

Reviews: I was sold a phone by this seller under the description of "used like new", the package arrived before the due date which was awesome and appeared to be as described, COSMETICALLY . The next day the charger wasn't working, no big deal chargers are easy to replace. A week to the day I received the product it quit working completely. I notified the seller immediately!! He replied within 2 hours, explaining he worked in the week and would get back to me over the weekend with options of how to go about fixing the problem. Which in turn ended up in me sending a second email of which he informed me that he would not give me a refund, and offered $40 maximum... I BARLEY HAD THE PHONE A WEEK!!!!! THE PHONE WAS NOT IN WORKING CONDITIONS, AND I SPENT ALMOST $400 IN THE PRODUCT AND SHIPPING FOR A BROKEN PHONE THAT THE SELLER BELIEVES IS NOW ONLY WORTH $40!!! I AM BEYOND UPSET AND I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THAT ANYONE MAKE A PURCHASE FROM CAM-O-RAMA WITH OUT HAVING A LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE TO LOOK FOR LOOP HOLES IN THE REFUNDING DEPARTMENT! I WILL NEVER BUY ANYTHING OFF OF AMAZON KNOWING THAT THERE IS REALLY PEOPLE LIKE THIS OUT HERE!! I read almost all the reviews and ratings before buying from this seller, as well as other sellers before making my purchase. I am now out of $400 dollars, and have a black screened iphone to show for it! THANK YOU CAM-O-RAMA!! FOR NOTHING!"Since I can only provide DOA (dead on arrival) guarantee and because the phone wasdelivered as in described condition (used but fully functional), Iwon't be able to take a full return for it. HOWEVER, I always do thebest I can to help my buyers. I would like to offer you a $40 refund..."

name: ndngenuity
Reviews: It wasn’t only a refurbished item instead of unused item. The IPhone 4 I received and sent back is a fraud.On october 17, I spent more than 2 hours at the Genius Bar of Apple Store at 5th Avenue, New York. They recommended me to do a back up first and come back the other day.The following day, 18, in Apple Store at 14th Street, New York, I spent another 2 hours at the Genius Bar just to know 1) that they couldn't just replace the phone because it was out of warranty - it expired two years before, one year after it had been bought by its first owner, in June 2010. So if wanted a replacement I'd have to pay US$ 150 for it - which I accepted; and 2) at the very moment of the transaction, the guy who served me at the shop counter noticed something in the iPhone and asked me to wait. He checked the serial number and found that the iPhone was originally a black one - the one I bought was a white one. He couldn't replace it.They didn't have a new iPhone 4 to sell, and I needed desperately to buy a cell phone because I was leaving the next day to Brazil. I bought an iPhone 5C unlocked for $649 + taxes, as you can see in the annexed file. Total: US$ 706.59.If you want to be fair, please deposit the difference of U$ 266,50 (706,59 - 439,98) I had to pay. I wont charge for the four hours of my vacation I wasted at Apple’s counter, neither for the worry and inconvenience I had with your item .I send alrady several emails and I'm still waiting for an answer. Hope to hear from you soon.

name: GREATNESSEOA
Reviews: As stated in the description, the iPhone had little to no scratches around the phone. Good Job here. After turning it on, here's where the problems began to stir up. Due note that I previously owned a 4s prior and only ordered this one because I loved the phone, lost the phone and thought I'd try another one.Music - I'm a BIG fan of music. With this phone, I am not able to play music, smoothly from Tune In as once before. The issue starts whenever I have Wifi and Carrier service on at the same time. Never a problem with prior.GMaps + Music - Normally, I could listen to music while getting directions from GMaps. With this phone, every turn-by-turn direction causes my music to stop completely and I have to press play in order to start the music again. Never a problem with prior.Home Double-Tap Button - When I attempt to use this feature to navigate through opened apps, it would work about 1 out of 5 tries. Never a problem with prior.Wifi On/Off - Normally, I could turn my wifi on/off, interchangeably, between use with apps and never had a problem; however, apps recognize that the wifi is off and only consider this the designated source for data transfer. To fix, I've had to turn the phone off completely for it to refresh. Never a problem with prior.I am currently in the process of returning this phone, for they have a 90 Day Return policy. Fingers are crossed to see if I get a better replacement.Hopefully this review has helped make a decision for you in the future.

name: CorbettPM
Reviews: I was sold a phone by this seller under the description of "used like new", the package arrived before the due date which was awesome and appeared to be as described, COSMETICALLY . The next day the charger wasn't working, no big deal chargers are easy to replace. A week to the day I received the product it quit working completely. I notified the seller immediately!! He replied within 2 hours, explaining he worked in the week and would get back to me over the weekend with options of how to go about fixing the problem. Which in turn ended up in me sending a second email of which he informed me that he would not give me a refund, and offered $40 maximum... I BARLEY HAD THE PHONE A WEEK!!!!! THE PHONE WAS NOT IN WORKING CONDITIONS, AND I SPENT ALMOST $400 IN THE PRODUCT AND SHIPPING FOR A BROKEN PHONE THAT THE SELLER BELIEVES IS NOW ONLY WORTH $40!!! I AM BEYOND UPSET AND I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THAT ANYONE MAKE A PURCHASE FROM CAM-O-RAMA WITH OUT HAVING A LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE TO LOOK FOR LOOP HOLES IN THE REFUNDING DEPARTMENT! I WILL NEVER BUY ANYTHING OFF OF AMAZON KNOWING THAT THERE IS REALLY PEOPLE LIKE THIS OUT HERE!! I read almost all the reviews and ratings before buying from this seller, as well as other sellers before making my purchase. I am now out of $400 dollars, and have a black screened iphone to show for it! THANK YOU CAM-O-RAMA!! FOR NOTHING!"Since I can only provide DOA (dead on arrival) guarantee and because the phone wasdelivered as in described condition (used but fully functional), Iwon't be able to take a full return for it. HOWEVER, I always do thebest I can to help my buyers. I would like to offer you a $40 refund..."

name: franchise02
Reviews: When I got the package everything looked all right, but appearances can be deceiving. The USB connector would not accept any cable, just the one shipped inside. This is weird, but I could live with that glitch. Then, 2 weeks later, I noticed that all pictures taken with the front camera got blured and the 5M Pixels back camera had some issues in focusing the image.After 2 months using, I figured some extra bad surprises. The front speaker just went dead 3 days ago, the phone wont ring or produce any sound anymore!!!! Also, there is something wrong with the earphone jack as well, because during song playing we can hear "pops" and sudden pauses, just like in vynil players. Moreover, the "Face Proximity Sensor" never worked, but I didnt even know it exists, so I could not find out sooner.I took it to an Apple authorized Repair Shop, and to my surprise I was informed that identified that the iPhone was refurbished with a lot of low quality spare parts, including the cameras (back and front ones), and even the front touch screen glass!!I have no doubt that the phone was not "Very good" as advertised. Not at all!! I payed a good money for it, and will cost me a lot of extra money to repair it, which is not acceptable.

name: andreawalls21
Reviews: Check out this facebook page that outlines their shady business practices: [...]The 1-star rating is not for the iphone itself - that would be a 5-star. The 1-star rating is for the seller - WIREOVIAI bought this in March 2012, seeing that it was "Factory Unlocked by Apple, Never Opened" and "New In Shrink-Wrap and Original Packaging".Just yesterday, a little over 2 months of having the phone, the speaker stopped working so I bring it into Apple, thinking it would be covered under warranty.The apple employee informs me that the iphone was owned and registered in September 2010 - 17 months before I bought this "new" iphone.Do not buy ANYTHING from this vendor - WIREOVIA - as you cannot trust the authenticity of what they're selling! What you buy would also not be covered under the manufacturer's warranty if it's older than you think it is. You will just end up with a useless, piece of junk and less several hundred dollars.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 A1332 32GB White (GSM Unlocked)
name: nanceebing
Reviews: Bought2 of these through Vantage Cellular. The phones were wrapped like new. Looked great. All appeared good. Then little things were noticed. When the screen went black I would see phantom keyboard characters throughout the screen. Similar to how monitors react if the same picture stays on too long and the pixels freeze, same thins with this. I was supposed to get iPhone 4S', not 4's. I even verified the link after purchase and it showed up 4S. Now I had a problem with one phone not turning on and just a black screen. Was told it was the battery, when the phone was opened to replace said battery, low and behold - These aren't real iPhones. So now my ordered iPhone 4S' turn out to be fake iPhone 4's. Will will say 'return them and why did you not send them back right away?' Well, I work overseas and was only home to pick them up for a very short time and returning them was out of the question as the phones were needed when I returned. So how do we fix this? Stay tuned and I will update this as things unfold.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 A1332 32GB White (GSM Unlocked)
name: CLChicosky
Reviews: After saving up for several months, I was able to purchase my very first high-end phone. At the time I first bought this phone, it was still considered out of date, but I didn't care. I was very excited to finally have an all in one high quality music player, cell phone, and handheld computer. I remember being most excited, besides the app inclusions, that this product had 32 whole gb to play with. That was more than I'd ever had in my mp3 players/ ipods of the past.Pros-Huge GB Space-App Store-High quality music playback (However, I believe the Sansa line of Mp3 players has a much better quality of music playback and higher volume offering. This is the only one I have found.)-Glass pieces rather than plastic-Unlocked for use with multiple phone servicesCons-Buggy at times-Outdated-Does not support many apps-New OS does not run very smoothly on this-One speaker was busted-Grossly overpriced-You can find an Andriod that improves on this system in every way for a quarter of the priceI have since updated to a less expensive Android phone with expandable memory (LG K700) as even the cheap ones run better OS than this old thing nowadays. For the time though, this piece of software was very innovative and very exciting to have. If you are in the market for a new phone, I would recommend a newer piece of equipment though, rather than springing for this item, even if it is the Apple Store you are looking for. Many apps do not even run on this any longer. A new andriod would save your pocket some dough, and offer you higher improvements.

Reviews: Never buy from Next Gen Wireless.The phone I got had a broken receiver and I could only listen to phone calls on speaker phone. I had to return the phone after spending hours looking online for solutions and trying to figure out what the problem was. When I contacted them about the problem and returned it, they said they would 'have their technicians inspect it' before refunding the money. The phone most definitely did not work and they got back to me saying that their technicians couldnt find anything wrong with the phone and that they would refund me, but charge me a "restocking fee" since the phone was now "used."On top of that, they sent me fake headphones and a fake charging cord. Apple blocks unauthorized lightning cords and when I finally gave up with the phone and went to back it up before returning it, the cord never worked, never charged the phone, and couldnt form a connection with my itunes. The battery life on the phone was also practically nothing which leads me to believe the phone was either also fake or used/refurbished. Either one sucks since I paid for what was listed as a new phone and ended up paying them to take it back "used" - probably to sell it to someone else new again.If I could I would give 0 stars. This is a bs product from a bs company with terrible customer service and service, period.

name: BolerChris
Reviews: As stated in the description, the iPhone had little to no scratches around the phone. Good Job here. After turning it on, here's where the problems began to stir up. Due note that I previously owned a 4s prior and only ordered this one because I loved the phone, lost the phone and thought I'd try another one.Music - I'm a BIG fan of music. With this phone, I am not able to play music, smoothly from Tune In as once before. The issue starts whenever I have Wifi and Carrier service on at the same time. Never a problem with prior.GMaps + Music - Normally, I could listen to music while getting directions from GMaps. With this phone, every turn-by-turn direction causes my music to stop completely and I have to press play in order to start the music again. Never a problem with prior.Home Double-Tap Button - When I attempt to use this feature to navigate through opened apps, it would work about 1 out of 5 tries. Never a problem with prior.Wifi On/Off - Normally, I could turn my wifi on/off, interchangeably, between use with apps and never had a problem; however, apps recognize that the wifi is off and only consider this the designated source for data transfer. To fix, I've had to turn the phone off completely for it to refresh. Never a problem with prior.I am currently in the process of returning this phone, for they have a 90 Day Return policy. Fingers are crossed to see if I get a better replacement.Hopefully this review has helped make a decision for you in the future.

Reviews: As these iPhones progress they just keep getting better and better. If you have had an earlier iPhone you will be able to work this one as well. The nice thing about apple is when they make their next gen. of phone you don't have to relearn the hole phone again. The new phone will run just like the older one but with more kool and better stuf. I compare it to driving a Toyota. If you drive a camery, and upgrade it to a newer model the new one is still set up inside just like the old one but with nicer stuf.I started out with Apple using the iPod touch. Loving it I figured I'd try the iPhone. Well I love it too. It is so user friendly and easy to navigate that it is a no brainer of most everything. But at the same time the iPhone is full of very useful things. It is really a pocket computer. To put it simply.If you are a real computer tech, it may not have some of the things that the droid has, but you don't have to spend a month or more to learn the thing either.If you have any other Apple mobile product and you like it, you will love the iPhone as well.

Reviews: The iphones do not come unlocked / unblocked when you see a carrier logo after it. So you are unable to use another carrier provider. The iphone that was sent to me by the seller came with a used sim card with an outstanding balance on it of an account that was opened and closed before I even purchased the phone. (Information I received from AT&T) The seller now tells me "...We are also unable to match your IMEI to our records to try to assist you." So I would like to know who took my money for the purchase of the phone, did I get phone from one of their employees who put their phone in my shipment, as it is not registered with them, as they are the only ones with access to shipping the iphone to me. A mystery that will most likely will never be solved. BEWARE

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 Black Smartphone 32GB (AT&T)
name: jdbwaffles
Reviews: I was extremely elated that I found this on amazon at a great price! I destroyed my iPhone 4 by getting it wet & it was unreviveable. I went to the AT&T store & a new one would've cost me $800 plus tax! Yikes! This was because I wasn't eligible for my discounted upgrade yet. They actually suggested I look on here for a refurbished alternative. I am glad that I did, as it saved me about $500! The phone I received was in good condition, it was a little dirty though. I cleaned it with some rubbing alcohol on a Q-tip & good to go! They even sent me a charging cord with it! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars, is that the plug in on the phone is a little off. It fits the charger they sent, which looks like an old iPod charger. So, I'm assuming that my refurb has an old iPod plug in. It doesn't quite fit all of my iPhone accessories as securely as I had hoped due to this fact. It still works with them, but it is a loose fit, so my iPhone can't be touched or moved in anyway while attached, otherwise it will disconnect from the accessory. My suggestion for future refurbs is to make sure it's an iPhone plug in on the phone, as there is a slight difference. Otherwise, no big scratches on the phone & synced right up with my iTunes & all my apps & contacts are back immediately! That's what I love about the iPhone, I wouldn't have any other phone!

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 Black Smartphone 32GB (AT&T)
name: masonkesner
Reviews: I bought this phone back in March, when there was no unlock available for it. So it sit in my house untouched. Granted I had already had a factory unlocked 4S. Anyway, a couple of weeks ago I remembered that I stuck in in my dresser drawer until there was a way to unlock it from AT&T.I found a website, [...] in which you pay $60 to a company in the UK and they'll unlock it via the IMEI number so when you log onto iTunes it will be recognized as a factory unlocked iPhone. Paid the $60, boom. Gave it to the wife and she loves it, and we're now on T-Mobile.So, back in March I paid $330 for it, plus $60 = $390. Which is $110.00 cheaper than what it's being sold for today. Very happy with this purchase!

name: Allisonjones704
Reviews: Great phone on AT&T! For people upgrading: I had an iPhone 3GS 32GB before this, and I enjoyed that phone, but once you see the display on this phone, you won't be able to go back!!Pros:Retina Display (960x640 pixels, 326 pixels per inch)- AMAZING QUALITY.FaceTime Camera- Not best picture quality, but good for FaceTime with other iOS devices.Everything about the iPhone- The App Store, mostly. Lots of great apps compared to Android App Store and others.Cons:Heavier than iPhone 3GS- Yes, it is. People love the "PREMIUM" feel of the iPhone 4, for me, I think I liked the lighter iPhone 3GS.Prone to shattering glass on front AND BACK, because there is glass on back.NOTE: The antenna is not that bad if you put a case on it, the death grip only happens when you actually hold it with your hand.Great phone, overall 9/10 in terms of blow-away display, 720p video recording camera on back, and glass/aluminum finish.

I was lucky and had one replaced with a new one.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4 Black Smartphone 32GB (AT&T)
name: brettel
Reviews: After spending decades running away from Macintosh/Apple products this Phone is Supreme!It may be time to look into a Mac again. It is so intuitive. Functions with such ease, and has features I could have only imagined would be available later. Coupled with AT&Ts ability to surf and talk, others can only imitate and never duplicate. I have no need for my other MP3 player, since I can talk on the phone with background music that doesn't interfere and with portable speakers have home, bedside, or office music that I like. With 32GB of memory you can include a few full length movies for those times when you have to wait in an airport or where ever. Access to the internet is almost as good as my laptop. it provides you access to secure sights not available with the Blackberry. Given that it is a phone, I realistically don't expect the same speeds as bigger computing media but this is perfectly adequate. Don't know why I waited so long, but glad I took the leap.

Upon receipt, the iPhone was filthy with built up grime in all crevices and there was yellow discoloration one side of the screen most likely due to screen replacement. However, this was just the beginning before I noticed the functional issues. For work, I use speaker phone frequently, so the broken speaker and mic was a disappointment. Then, I noticed the battery was draining far too quickly. The battery was bad. I tried to pick up a deal and I got a complete lemon. You may get a good phone, but you're rolling the dice.

Reviews: The phone arrived as promised and packaged well. It did appear to be a new phone complete with charger and ear buds. The curious part came when I tried to activate it. Went online at Sprint and entered the activation number that I found on the sticker on the outside of the box. The system would not take it. After three tries I was connected to a chat line. I was asked to once again enter the number and it was once again rejected. I was told to turn on the phone and check the number stored in the phone. I did and found it was different than the number on the box. When we entered that number the activation was completed.So I was just curious why a new phone would come in a box that had different activation numbers. Otherwise, 5 stars.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Locked to Sprint
name: aemccollum
Reviews: This was my first ever Iphone purchase.I wanted to compare the difference from android to iphone. This phone in particular when I got it, I was in shock at how fast the phone was, how quick it turned on. I was able to connect to wifi faster then my current phone at the time. I bought this phone as a extra side phone for wifi use mainly only. Games etc... I well spent my moneys worth. I really did like the browser speed when you connect to the internet and get on chrome etc..The updates to the phone let you know they need to be installed, I did like that. Security on the phone i was also impressed with on locking the phone and how easy it was to set it up.Another positive I will add to this, I liked how fast the games played on this.. There were numerous games I downloaded where the speed of the phone kept up with the game. keno games got my quite a few times LOL Speed of the phone seemed to keep up also when I had more then 1 screen. At one point I had so many apps between several screens, it really did not affect the speed of the phone.It charges quite fast, even when I was using it or playing games while charging it, it charges fast! The camera was very good quality, even for a smaller camera then I am use to, takes some getting use to. Takes pictures very fast, love the quality, easy to figure it out. One of the main features I bought this for to try out was SIRI, It worked as I read as it should. You press the button ask her a question, and she really answers it! It's like another person hiding in your phone lol I will be buying another Iphone soon, They are made for quick easy access to whatever.I recommend this phone to anyone, its well made, very fast and it does last!

Reviews: Such a great phone. Got it six months after it came out in 2012 and just upgraded to another phone a few days ago (2016). Very solid, and sturdy. I had it in a rubber case that I bought at the 99 cent store and dropped it many times but the screen never cracked. And the home button, power, volume, and vibration switch still work. Got lucky I suppose. New updates have made it slow though. I changed the battery myself twice since 2012 and it worked pretty well, lasted me all day sometimes but I only texted and used instagram/facebook/web, I didn't game. Since then I bought three of the same for my family as well. People made fun of me for having such an old, small screen, fat, phone compared to their iPhone 6s, etc. but it still works just fine. I'll miss you my sweet, fat, slow prince.

name: Heartliss
Reviews: Most people know what the iPhone is all about, so there's no need for me to rant about the different features it has. However, what I will say that this is a true upgrade coming the Blackberry Torch 9850. I didn't upgrade because i wanted to, but because I had to. Im happy I ran into that obligation. my choice of phones was between the 4s or the 5. I wasn't eligible for an upgrade until mid June of next year I was force to buy a phone for the full price and surprisingly both the iPhone 4S and 5 were the same price (649.99+ tax). When I compared both phone, I didn't see any distinct feature(s) that the 5 had over the 4s (besides being faster and thinner) so I decided to buy the 4s from a third party (Amazon) saving me over $200. I must say I am very please with this phone. Now I see why Apply customer are nuts.

I was even threatened to be reported to Amazon, situation that never happened and I have e-mails and evidence to proove it.4. I got 10 usd in reward from amazon for the whole situation, which DOES NOT compensate all I went through.Conclusion: I still have a locked phone with Sprint with a charger that doesnt work, and my problem remains unsolved.Sorry but if there was a chance to give MedMedia246 half a star or even a NEGATIVE rate i would definetely do it.

name: TomFutureforall
Reviews: The iPhone was represented as used, which it was. The description did not mention the Otter commuter box which came with the iPhone, which was a nice surprise. However, the iPhone has been less reliable than my previous new phone was, although how I use the phone has not changed. I noticed the first day that the battery runs down faster, and is sometimes depleted before the day is over. A new twist is that now I cannot put some calls through. When I enter a phone number to place a phone call, the screen indicates the call is connected because the seconds are incrementing. However, I don't hear a ring or hear the receiving party. This is inconvenient for a phone. I wonder what feature will have reduced functionality next. I expected that a phone, although used, would be more reliable and that its deficits would have been clearly described in the offering information. Even on Amazon, with a highly ranked seller, buyer beware.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Locked to Sprint
name: LE2BIGDAVE
Reviews: After having this phone activated I found it was defective, The volume was abnormally low even when turned up to the max. I took the phone in to the Sprint store and they ran a diagnostic test. They did confirm there was an issue but could not do more than a diagnostic without opening the phone. I procrastinated sending the phone back because I wanted to remove my personal data and did not receive a full refund. I won't be order a phone online again.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Locked to Sprint
name: ncuccia
Reviews: When I read the description, it stated that the phone would have light, minimal scratched on the screen. The front and back screen were in great condition, however, there were many more issues. The battery was toast, and shut the phone off at 20%. The metal frame is bent at the top of the phone, making it hard to use a case. The flash doesn't work. The camera has dark spots, the charger that came with the phone doesn't work. The speaker is blown, and people can't hear me. I contacted the seller, and the response was quick, but it was as useful as not contacting them at all. They offered to repair everything minus the metal frame, but I'd have to send the phone back on my dollar, and be stuck without a phone until they sent it back. Nothing else. Of course, I didn't send it back. Be very cautious when buying.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Locked to Sprint
name: Gregg_Silver
Reviews: The phone is Sprint, but the SIM card tray was not from original phone. When I took it to Apple to have it activated, they used the IEMI from the SIM tray.That IEMI was from an AT&T phone, which immediately locked the phone to AT& T. They did a hard factory reset, it is still locked to AT&T. It is an expensive paperweight now. The phone was advertised to be in "very good condition" I would say the chipped glass corners, different SIM tray, the various scratches all over the phone, is NOT "very good" , maybe "fair condition" but no way in a "very good condition". The seller refused to accept that there were irregularities with the IEMI in SIM tray versus the IEMI within the phone , the quality of the phone as I stated above and he made excuses such as "you were sent the right phone, someone switched them in the mail". I would caution anyone purchasing a used phone, just don't! You want an iPhone that works, then please purchase a new phone that is not locked to any carrier.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Verizon
name: kelliwilson02
Reviews: I recently bought an iPhone 4S from this seller. When it arrived it looked fine. We went to Verizon to set it up- and here is where the problem started. The camera light would not turn off, the tech said that's a sign of water damage and it was literally draining the battery at very rapid rate. I booked a Genius Bar appointment at apple to see if it could be fixed. When they opened up the phone they discovered it has been tampered with, voiding the warranty and the light was not repairable.Contacted the seller who sent us another iPhone 4S. POTENTIAL BUYERS READ THIS: given our issue with the last phone we booked another apple store appointment just to have the phone checked out. It's even worse this time around, the apple tech said it had been tampered with and cautioned us to get rid of the phone as soon as possible. When I pushed him for details on what was wrong with the phone, He said the phone had been tampered with to the point that it can be used for IDENTITY THEFT, basically opening any accounts used on the phone and getting account information- he wasn't supposed to tell us this but thank god he did! Almost everyone I know has a banking app or email with very private information.No matter how much it ends up costing you, do not buy from this seller. I'm fairly certain all of the positive reviews are from people who are none the wiser and never had their phones inspected by an apple tech. Remember that it takes over a year to get your identity back if its stolen, not worth it for a used iPhone.

Reviews: The phone is being returned because the battery would not charge properly. The phone appeared new and I never had the Apple store check it out, so it may or may not be a refurb, returned or used one. Remember that these 4S phones were all built at the same time. So that means that even if you get a new phone, it will have an ancient battery. The phone would take an inordinately long time to charge and would never get up to 100%. After three weeks it got so bad that I was trying to charge it almost all day long. and had to put it into airplane mode so that it could even get up to 40% charge.I would recommend that anyone buying an older phone be very careful to see that the phone charges normally right out of the gate. If it does not, send it back.

In terms of functionality, well all of it's apps work, I can't say the same thing for my Android phone,Sure I have a Mac Mini at home and everything integrates well, which is how it should all work. I actually do some Mac programming and I'm a long time Unix lover so the mac is perfect for me, my phone, which runs the latest and greatest OS does so and will continue to because Apple doesn't fragment their iOS distro unlike other companies. There is basically one platform which makes life simple for developers...enough of this stuffThe bottom line is that it works, from Siri to browsing, texting and integrating with my desktop. I very much like that I can watch the stock market on the phone. I am very surprised that it is so easy to hold in my small hand, and it is so light. We're keeping it, as we don't want the hassle of returning it and being without a phone, but overall we're disappointed with it. After 6 months, we're still disappointed. Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Verizon
name: GainesJohnson
Reviews: Since there are already a lot of reviews of the phone I'm going to focus on the experience of buying a refurbished one. The phone arrived in a used iPhone 4s box that had seen better days. Inside the box was a plastic tray with a single compartment containing the phone. The compartment was much larger than the phone, so the device was not actually secure in the packaging. Under the try I found the charger and a small booklet as expected. I buy a lot of refurbished electronics and it looks like in this case the seller may use the term refurbished a bit loosely based on the packaging. The phone was in good condition, but I had some trouble finding the ESN. It was on a label on the outside of the box and for some reason someone had placed another label over it making the numbers hard to read. Fortunately the ESN is available on an iPhone in the About screen on the phone. Activating was easy and this replaced my current phone rather than requiring a new line.The phone is in good condition and the battery seems fine. In retrospect, I saved a bit of money over buying from the manufacturer, but would probably feel a bit more comfortable about the device had I gone that route instead.

name: Qwhocooks
Reviews: Ok, I know its 2016 and I just bought a phone that is ~4 years old but, my Android was in its last days and I didn't want to get into another long term financing agreement with Verizon so I made the jump to Apple yesterday and thought the 4s was a good way to see if I like iphone. Price was good, arrived next day as promised by DigitalandMore and it is brand new in factory package. Activated the phone easily. First call I receive, I can barely hear the caller, second call same thing... I turn up every volume button I can find and finally resort to Google. Well, guess what? Common problem with 4s so I've tried every potential solution I could find online and still no better. I will be reaching out to seller to work out a return but want you all to know of this issue that never showed up in reviews until I specifically searched "low call volume."

Also angry about the amount of time I am going to have to spend trying to deal with this issue again, as like most people, I need a working phone, and this one is obviously defective.It appears from the reviews I am not the only one who has been cheated by this particular seller.Pretty pathetic way to make money I would say.

name: JesicaLSantos
Reviews: Purchased this phone on July 19th, 2013. It was listed as in "new" condition. The phone occasionally failed to switch on, but I was able to get it to activate by holding down both buttons for 15 seconds or so. Finally on or about January 25th, 2014 it failed to switch on and I could not get it to activate. Took it to Verizon ( where I had previously taken it when it would not activate) and they too could not get it to open. I was advised by you that the phone was out of warranty. Took it to the Apples Store ( a 180 mile round trip from my home) where they quickly brought it back by removing the battery and then replacing the same battery. ( basically re-booting)The Apple technician was able to tell me that the phone was originally purchased from Apple in mid 2012 at a store in Las Vegas and that it showed signs of having been "refurbished."Given that supposition I would find it very hard to rate this provider other than one star. I am very disappointed.

name: brownsrock
Reviews: We bought this phone to replace a 4S that we had that cracked. I was hesitant to purchase a cell phone through Amazon but turned out fine! Works as well as the one we pd over $300 for 2 yrs ago. The phone looked new - no scratches - no damage of any type. The only bad thing was the wall charger had a cut in the cord. It looked like a knife or box cutter type cut down to the actual wire but not through the wires. It didn't effect the use of the charger - it still worked fine but just for safety reasons we just tossed it back in the box and are using our previous charger. So this wasn't a big deal to us because we had an additional charger but I know this would be irritating to many. But I'm giving this 4 stars because the phone itself was like a new quality and shipped really quick. Packaging was also very good - it came in a 4S new looking box with the ear buds and charger. Overall happy with purchase.

name: weezerandburnie
Reviews: About JoyCells: I bought a 16 GB refurbed iPhone 4s from them a few weeks ago. It arrived quickly and the packaging was really smart, a plastic wrapper kept the phone strapped to the bottom of the box so the phone wasn't bouncing around during shipping. The order was fulfilled by Amazon so it had the Prime shipping, and I felt good knowing that I was backed with Amazons return policy should the phone be a dud. I have had no problem with the phone itself, it is in good working condition, clean, and undamaged though I can tell it is a used phone as it has some min or dings on the back glass panel. The phone came in an iPhone 4s box, with a charger, but no ear buds.About the 4s: I bought this phone because my Galaxy S4 had a tragic end and my contract wont give me a new phone for another 7 months. This phone was inexpensive so that's what won out. In general, I don't like the iPhone as much as I like my GS4. Don't quite know what else to say about it. The screen is VERY small for what I am used too, and that's my main complaint.

name: ImBillNichols
Reviews: The only reason I gave it 1 star is because technically I got a phone and it works. BUT. This was advertised as a "NEW" sealed phone. About 2 months after I got it the battery started draining really fast. I am familiar with best practices to extend battery life etc., so this indicated that the phone was not, in fact, new. At least the battery wasn't!Some time later I opened up the included earbuds and plugged them in, only to find out that they are really awful. The sound is bad, and it goes in and out. if you barely touch the cord, the sound glitches, indicating that internal wires may be loose. But they were "NEW", remember? Upon further examination, I'm pretty sure that they are knock-off buds, not true Apple buds.If I had purchased a phone that was honestly advertised as used/refurbished, I wouldn't have been as upset by these things. But to buy a "new" phone, only to be searching within months for a replacement battery, and spending additional money on a new pair of ear buds, is very frustrating. False advertising, to say the least. Feels like I was lied to.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Verizon
name: idk_but_youtube
Reviews: Initially I had reservations about buying a refurbished iPhone, especially online, when you cant see your purchase beforehand.However, the price difference between a device from the Verizon store, about 200 dollars, is hard to deny. happybook1 put me at ease with her prompt email responses and patience handling my questions. I contacted her during the weekend, expecting hours or even days before a reply, but she emailed back within 20 minutes. When you buy from her store, you'll get almost an immediate email detailing your purchase and its tracking code, as well as an entreaty to take up any complaints or issues with her, which she will resolve to the best of her ability. I placed my order for an iPhone 4s- locked to Verizon on Saturday, and received it Wednesday, two days before the earliest delivery estimate, secured in a bubble wrapped envelope that was placed inside a tightly taped Priority cardboard box. The phone was in better condition than described, looking brand-new to all except the most discerning eye. It also came with new Apple earbuds, a USB connector, and front-and-back screen protectorsWhen buying an iPhone, or any other smartphone online, one runs the risk of getting a stolen item or encountering other ploys by unscrupulous sellers. I highly recommend happybook1 and am very satisfied with this transaction

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Verizon
name: APOinc
Reviews: I recently bought an iPhone 4S from this seller. When it arrived it looked fine. We went to Verizon to set it up- and here is where the problem started. The camera light would not turn off, the tech said that's a sign of water damage and it was literally draining the battery at very rapid rate. I booked a Genius Bar appointment at apple to see if it could be fixed. When they opened up the phone they discovered it has been tampered with, voiding the warranty and the light was not repairable.Contacted the seller who sent us another iPhone 4S. POTENTIAL BUYERS READ THIS: given our issue with the last phone we booked another apple store appointment just to have the phone checked out. It's even worse this time around, the apple tech said it had been tampered with and cautioned us to get rid of the phone as soon as possible. When I pushed him for details on what was wrong with the phone, He said the phone had been tampered with to the point that it can be used for IDENTITY THEFT, basically opening any accounts used on the phone and getting account information- he wasn't supposed to tell us this but thank god he did! Almost everyone I know has a banking app or email with very private information.No matter how much it ends up costing you, do not buy from this seller. I'm fairly certain all of the positive reviews are from people who are none the wiser and never had their phones inspected by an apple tech. Remember that it takes over a year to get your identity back if its stolen, not worth it for a used iPhone.

Product Name: Apple iPhone 4S 16GB (Black) - Verizon
name: DanJWillis
Reviews: The bottom line is that I disliked this phone so much that I returned it! I know you're not supposed to say that about Apple products, but read on to see why I think people are largely "drinking the Koolaid" on the iPhone.The Bad: When I first wanted a smartphone I got a very cheap Droid, which was hard to sync between the Mac home computer I use and my Google email accounts. Eventually I got it working, but I anticipated that the almighty iPhone would be seamless right out of the box. It wasn't -- with the iPhone I had all the same troubles going back to the Google accounts that I had had with the Droid going to the Apple products the first time around. Not fun.I also didn't like that there is NO app available to back SMS text messages up to your Gmail or other email account the way there is for Android phones (SMS Backup+). In the event of a phone change, and god forbid you do not want another iProduct, you will lose all of those conversations.I couldn't organize the screens the way I wanted them.I missed having my contacts' pictures show up next to text messages and in my phone address book. (It's the little things, but still!)The "back" menus will probably frustrate former Droid users, as sometimes you have to use the actual butto at the bottom of the phone to go back to the Home screen, but sometimes you want the real "back" button on the screen which is usually (but not always) located at the top. This is counterintuitive and annoying.The Good: The camera worked well, the screen was beautiful and the sound was good. Size is great compared to the other expensive Android models which are a bit like holding an entire computer up to your head. Also, there are no rights issues with older iTunes purchases which I have yet to resolve on my new Android.The Verdict: Overall I was disappointed in the operating system I think largely because the iPhone is supposed to be the gold standard among smartphones and I had heard wonderful, glowing things from so many people who LOOOOVE their iPhones. However, naysayers come out of the woodwork once they realize that they will have a sympathetic ear in someone who isn't subscribing blindly to the iUniverse, and there are a fair number of people who prefer the Droids. To me the final factor may be how computer-savvy you are going in, and how much time you want to put into learning about your phone and all the different service providers and programs that will, in theory at least, work together to get it to do what you want it to do. If you're willing to take the time, you might eventually prefer an Android. If not, the iPhone is definitely not as simple as I thought it would be but I would still recommend it for anyone who doesn't have the technological know-how or desire to play detective in order to get things set up.I will add that when combined with trying to find the right cellular service provider (Verizon has NONEXISTANT customer service and everything requires several phone calls as well as hours on hold to get anything done, AT&T has less signal strength in my area and I couldn't get usable data to with T-Mobile through Straight Talk), buying a new phone and a smartphone in particular has been one of THE most frustrating experiences of my life. Once I get my current phone working (a Samsung Galaxy S3), I plan to keep it forever and to never, ever, ever make any changes to my "system" again! What an exercise in futility this has been!

name: oobunillaoo
Reviews: I bought this iPhone 4S from the Amazon Warehouse because of the great return policy. I wasn't sure what I would receive. The condition was described as Used - Like New which was a little too positive. Front and back sides were flawless, the metallic ring (antenna) had dirt and residue which I could not remove so far. The battery seems to be the original one which already shows signs of wear. Might need to replace with a new one soon.First thing I checked if the ESN/IMEI was clean which it was. It could even be activated with Tracfone in the BYOP program.Overall I am happy with the purchase although some other buyers reported that Amazon Warehouse Used - Like New meant really new. But that would not have worked with Tracfone since they require a previously Verizon-activated device in order to activate with their bring your own phone program (modified from their Page Plus acquisition).

name: PimpianaJones
Reviews: Purchased an iPhone 4S that was used yet in excellent condition from Amazon's Warehouse Deals for eighty bucks. The listing for this particular iPhone said it was in "Used - Good" condition. However, it was in really EXCELLENT condition. No scratches and no blemishes on the screen or on the back. The metal bezel frame also appeared to be in excellent condition. It turned on and could be activated. No icloud lock and not blacklisted. The iphone updated online easily to iOS 8.3 which is currently the latest iOS at the time of this review. Have purchased eight used iphones here on amazon and have given iphones to my sisters and can say that the iPhone 4S is a great safe starter phone if you want to get into Apple iPhones.Note that this is an AT&T iPhone. You can use it on AT&T and on AT&T GoPhone. And you can use it on any of the many AT&T MVNOs such as H2O Wireless, Airvoice, PureTalk, Consumer Cellular, and others. Also, you can now get the AT&T iPhone unlocked cheaply and legally and therefore be able to use this AT&T iPhone 4S on Tmobile or any of the various Tmobile MVNOs such as PTEL, GIV Mobile, Ultra Mobile, US Mobile, MetroPCS, and the others that are out there. Currently have PTEL (a tmobile mvno) on this AT&T iPhone 4S after unlocking it via a cheap three-buck unlocking service found here on Amazon.

name: Amrutafrika
Reviews: It's January 5th, 2016 and I have had this phone since late November. It came to my post office in its own new box and with it came a USB port, charger, and little ear phones. The phone was, as advertised, white, 16 GB, and it was unlocked, and set to the IOS 7 version. While I had read there were plenty of issues rising from Unlocked IPhone 4S phone locking back after updating to the new IOS 9.2, I was a little iffy but I took the chance and it updated without any problems. As I usually have TERRIBLE luck with phones, I am actually more than ecstatic about how well this phone has behaved for me. As for the battery, I use my phone for surfing, checking Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, and watching Youtube videos, and I listen to music constantly; I also text constantly. Because of that, my battery lasts on the average of 6-7 hours (if that), but I have recently bought an IPhone 4s battery case (1400 mAh) and it has practically doubled my battery life. So for the phone itself, this beautiful thing has a soul and I am VERY pleased with my purchase and will consider purchasing from the vendor again if something (god forbid) should happen to this one. thank you for the honest buy AppleComputer.

Reviews: Pros:The device works well with no issues so far and it looks like a brand new oneCons:1- This is NOT factory unlocked, I took it to the Apple store and told me that the device was unlocked a moth ago2- This is a Refurbished device. When you buy the device you have the option to choose a "new" or "used" device and I chose the new one but was told by the Apple store that it is used for several years.3- I was told by the Apple employee that the Back and front screens are after market parts and not original, even the box is a very cheap replica of the original one.4- Not worth the price. You can add $50 dollars to the price and get a Refurbished 5C phone, much nicer and updated version. I would have done that if they had mentioned it's condition in advance.
